about_the_game:
There's a traitor planning to murder everyone. Our mission is to survive and uncover who's behind this. I can count on you, right? Are you one of us?


Who's The Traitor throws you and your friends into a mistrustful situation where, every round, you'll receive a random name, color, and role. Each role has it's own objectives and a store with unique items.


  • Traitor - As a skillful traitor, you must eliminate all innocents and detectives. Bluff if you're asked something compromising. Make the most of a wide range of items and weapons to eliminate your targets in as many ways as possible.
  • Innocent - As a mere innocent, you must not only help the detective uncover the traitor but also ensure everyone is convinced that you are not a traitor before any injustice is committed. To do this, assist in opening the detective's room by performing tasks so the detective can analyze subjects and discover their roles.
  • Detective - As a qualified detective, you must use your authority to organize the least suspicious people, have them report any bodies they find, and perform tasks to open the detective's room, enabling the identification of their roles. Don't forget to utilize your unique tools available in the store.


Each of the three roles have a unique store with different items and weapons, ranging from technological devices that can help you find tasks nearby to weapons that can disrupt the target's playability. (Seriously, don't even try to aim if you get hit by a Sense Destroyer.)



Don't think you can just go around shooting everyone, causing harm to the wrong targets can result in penalties. This may include a reduced income, decreased damage, or even chat warnings about your behavior. We understand that mistakes happen, so rest assured, more severe penalties will only be applied in recurring cases. You can restore your virtue by not breaking the rules and doing tasks each round. The match hoster can disable this system if they wish.


Think the round time is too short? Or that the money per task is too high? That's not a problem in WTT, you can easily customize every aspect of a match through the match parameters menu. This way, you can adjust the game to fit your group of friends in the best way possible!
detailed_description:
There's a traitor planning to murder everyone. Our mission is to survive and uncover who's behind this. I can count on you, right? Are you one of us?


Who's The Traitor throws you and your friends into a mistrustful situation where, every round, you'll receive a random name, color, and role. Each role has it's own objectives and a store with unique items.


  • Traitor - As a skillful traitor, you must eliminate all innocents and detectives. Bluff if you're asked something compromising. Make the most of a wide range of items and weapons to eliminate your targets in as many ways as possible.
  • Innocent - As a mere innocent, you must not only help the detective uncover the traitor but also ensure everyone is convinced that you are not a traitor before any injustice is committed. To do this, assist in opening the detective's room by performing tasks so the detective can analyze subjects and discover their roles.
  • Detective - As a qualified detective, you must use your authority to organize the least suspicious people, have them report any bodies they find, and perform tasks to open the detective's room, enabling the identification of their roles. Don't forget to utilize your unique tools available in the store.


Each of the three roles have a unique store with different items and weapons, ranging from technological devices that can help you find tasks nearby to weapons that can disrupt the target's playability. (Seriously, don't even try to aim if you get hit by a Sense Destroyer.)



Don't think you can just go around shooting everyone, causing harm to the wrong targets can result in penalties. This may include a reduced income, decreased damage, or even chat warnings about your behavior. We understand that mistakes happen, so rest assured, more severe penalties will only be applied in recurring cases. You can restore your virtue by not breaking the rules and doing tasks each round. The match hoster can disable this system if they wish.


Think the round time is too short? Or that the money per task is too high? That's not a problem in WTT, you can easily customize every aspect of a match through the match parameters menu. This way, you can adjust the game to fit your group of friends in the best way possible!

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Ubuntu 12.04 LTS
  • Processor: Intel Core i3 4370 or AMD Ryzen 5 1600
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: 4GB video memory card

name: WHO'S THE TRAITOR

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10 64 bit - Windows 11 64 bit
  • Processor: Intel Core i3 4370 or AMD Ryzen 5 1600
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel HD Graphics 4400 or Radeon Vega 8
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10 64 bit - Windows 11 64 bit
  • Processor: Intel Core I5 8400 or AMD Ryzen 5 5600
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 6GB or AMD RX 5500XT 4GB
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 2 GB available space

short_description: WHO'S THE TRAITOR is a cooperative multiplayer FPS. Gather items, solve tasks, and work with strangers to figure out who is the traitor.
supported_languages: English, Spanish - Spain, Portuguese - Brazil, French, Italian, German, Arabic, Indonesian, Japanese, Polish, Russian, Simplified Chinese, Turkish, Hindi, Portuguese - Portugal, Spanish - Latin America
